image.altText: A concept design for an AFL stadium at Macquarie Point.

props.synopsis: Charles Touber brought world-class acts to Tasmania for 25 years. He's sceptical a new, roofed stadium on Hobart's Macquarie Point will attract the international stars the government says it will.

title.children: Sting, Rod Stewart, Billie Eilish and other big names 'next to impossible' for Hobart's promised stadium, promoter says

image.altText: A medicine bottle in a clear case

props.synopsis: Survivors are receiving an apology today for the pharmaceutical disaster which caused distress, disability and death for many Australian families. Follow live

title.children: Prime minister issues apology to thalidomide drug survivors 60 years on

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Apology will 'mean nothing' if there is no follow up says survivor
'These words cannot resolve years of anguish or pain'

image.altText: Tiny Pinder playing basketball on a amagazine cover in 1990

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation finds authorities missed multiple opportunities to deport an NBL player and serial rapist, despite him sexually abusing and stalking multiple women and girls in Australia.

title.children: He's a serial sexual predator who is no longer an Australian citizen. So why hasn't Tiny Pinder been deported?

image.altText: Fire crews at school fire.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government's draft Fire and Emergency Services Bill has unions worried firefighters will be expected to do the work of paramedics to fill gaps in a strained health system.

title.children: 'Dangerous proposal': Health union fears draft laws could see firefighters responding to medical emergencies

image.altText: A man looks straight ahead with green tinted sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Clare Nowland, who had dementia, died in Cooma Hospital in May a week after allegedly being tasered by Senior Constable Kristian White at her Yallambee Lodge nursing home.

title.children: NSW police officer charged with manslaughter over fatal tasering of Clare Nowland

image.altText: A man wearing a Ghutra sits and speaks in front of a backdrop with the 'COP28UAE' logo

props.synopsis: Leaked documents reveal the president of the UN’s global climate negotiations COP28, planned to use his role to push oil deals with other countries.

title.children: Leaked documents reveal president of the UN’s global climate negotiations used his role to push oil deals

image.altText: A man in a green army jacket sits in a wheelchair in a clearing in a wood

props.synopsis: An officer who led his troops into one of the key initial battles of Ukraine's counteroffensive labels the operation a failure.

title.children: This Ukrainian commander says leaks, fearsome choppers and poor planning doomed the counteroffensive

image.altText: A generic undated stock photo showing a map of Australia with heaps of pins stuck in it.

props.synopsis: While it's probably no surprise that governments spent billions of dollars fighting COVID-19, new data analysis shows how much Australians spent during the first three years of the pandemic.

title.children: How did Australia's COVID strategy compare to other countries? New data paints a striking picture

image.altText: A woman lying in bed blowing her nose with a tissue.

props.synopsis: After NSW Premier Chris Minns contracted the virus this week, he strongly recommended people stay at home until their COVID symptoms subside. Here's what the experts say.

title.children: Here's how long to self-isolate if you develop COVID symptoms amid Christmas peak concerns

image.altText: People disembarking a cruise ship in port.

props.synopsis: They had been hoping for a 13-day "Kiwi adventure" cruise; instead, these passengers arrived in Hobart after authorities stopped the ship from entering New Zealand waters because of a biosecurity risk.

title.children: Angry cruise ship passengers given Hobart holiday instead of New Zealand

image.altText: A bushwalker stands in button grass with eyes closed and smiles in the sun

props.synopsis: This YouTuber and Instagram adventure filmmaker was threatened with fines over his treks into Tasmania's wilderness areas. Now, he has been issued with a new "commercial filming licence" application — which he says he'll ignore because the strict conditions will kill his business.

title.children: Instagram adventurer won't abide by rules on filming in Tasmanian wilderness areas

image.altText: A supercell over Queensland

props.synopsis: Supercells are the biggest and baddest kind of severe thunderstorm, capable of producing violent winds, large hail, and tornadoes.

title.children: Eastern Australia rolling in storms and wild weather, including the most dangerous – supercell thunderstorms

image.altText: A person in high-vis with SES branding looks down a flooded street in a regional town.

props.synopsis: Residents in a South Coast town say the water level has risen by more than a metre since last night and more extreme weather is forecast for today as authorities scramble to respond to emergencies around the state.

title.children: Homes inundated, power outages and rescues amid widespread flooding in NSW

image.altText: A young person holding a small dog and standing outside between two armed men wearing balaclavas, standing near cars.

props.synopsis: For the first time since the truce began, both sides of the war trade accusations of serious ceasefire violations. Follow live.

title.children: Israel and Hamas trade ceasefire accusations as more prisoners and hostages are released

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: G7 foreign ministers support extension of pause in fighting in Gaza
'This truce must turn into a permanent ceasefire', Palestinian UN envoy says
There are hopes for a second extension to the temporary ceasefire

image.altText: People walk in the snow.

props.synopsis: Finland will close even its most remote border crossing with Russia, drawing a line in the Arctic snow, as it looks to stop asylum seekers flooding in from Russia.

title.children: Finland draws line in Arctic snow, closing entire border with Russia

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: The RBA's Michele Bullock says households are "doing fine" while speaking on a panel in Hong Kong last night. Follow live.

title.children: RBA's governor says Australians 'doing fine' as households ponder another rate hike

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Interest rate hikes are working to bring down inflation
Consumer prices coming down as annual inflation falls below 5 per cent
And some more on the RBA governor's 'challenge'

image.altText: A shot of a busy Melbourne street with pedestrians in front of a tram.

props.synopsis: The record-breaking level of migration triggers a public debate around its impact on Australia's inflation problem and a full-blown rental crisis.

title.children: Is the record level of migration fuelling inflation and the rental crisis?

image.altText: An illustration showing a woman with a cane, a man in a wheelchair, a woman who is an amputee and a child reading

props.synopsis: We spoke with people with disability and advocates, who shared their experiences. Check out the quiz to better understand what ableism and disability discrimination can look like.

title.children: How inclusive are you? Take our quiz on ableism and find out

image.altText: Jimmy Barnes mid sentence on the left of the picture wearing a black top with short grey hair, the background is out of focus

props.synopsis: The 67-year-old Cold Chisel frontman, who was slated to headline Rock The Boat festival this week, tells fans that doctors put him on two days of bed rest.

title.children: 'The timing couldn’t be worse': Jimmy Barnes hospitalised with pneumonia, cancels festival appearance

image.altText: Olemedia Books AI Brain

props.synopsis: Training AI models on copyrighted materials has led to an array of high-profile lawsuits against developers such as OpenAI and Meta. Can the models be "untrained" or is the genie out of the bottle?

title.children: ChatGPT and other AI models were trained on copyrighted books. Can they be 'untrained'?

image.altText: Inactive users could see their Google Drive, Docs and Gmail erased permanently.

props.synopsis: Google will begin phase one of erasing accounts deemed inactive from the beginning of December.

title.children: Google will start deleting 'inactive' accounts from Friday. Here's how to secure your data

image.altText: Close up of phone with someone about to place a bet on a sports game

props.synopsis: A man who was addicted to gambling for 20 years says he has watched the industry change from a punt at a local TAB to endless betting apps available at the swipe of a finger.

title.children: Gambling addict says online apps make it 'too easy' to feed addiction

image.altText: A hand pushes an electric cord into a car.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will return around $7 million worth of tax claimed from owners of electric vehicles after the excise was ruled unconstitutional.

title.children: Victorian government to repay electric vehicle tax 'with interest' after High Court ruling

image.altText: Chief Minister of the state of Uttarakhand, greeting a worker rescued.

props.synopsis: The 41 workers, trapped for 17 days inside a collapsed tunnel in India's Uttarakhand state, were freed one at a time on wheeled stretchers through a pipe 90cm wide.

title.children: After 17 days trapped all 41 Indian tunnel workers are rescued

image.altText: Kate has red hair tied up and she's wearing a fluro yellow vest and is leaning on boxes on food. She is smiling.

props.synopsis: People with disability are particularly vulnerable to food insecurity due to having extra costs such as medication and medical appointments, Foodbank WA's Kate O'Hara says.

title.children: 3.7 million households experienced food insecurity in the past year. Charities say demand for food is increasing

image.altText: Woman in a white and red printed shirt next to a young man in a light pink shirt at an outdoor bar.

props.synopsis: Hersh Goldberg-Polin was abducted by Hamas at the Supernova music festival in southern Israel. His mother is desperate for news about his welfare.

title.children: 'We're turning over every stone': Rachel Goldberg's battle to find her abducted son

image.altText: Pat Cummins smiling during an interview.

props.synopsis: Since taking over the Australian cricket captaincy, Pat Cummins has been outspoken on social issues, sparking backlash and claims from critics that he had become "too woke". But he says he feels emboldened by the negative responses.

title.children: 'I know who I am': Pat Cummins on refusing to pander to a 'loud minority'

image.altText: A man is wearing a cricket helmet while holding a cricket bat with two hands.

props.synopsis: Australia pulls off a miraculous win against India, with Glenn Maxwell dragging the team to its first victory of the series.

title.children: Australia chases down mammoth Indian total thanks to record-equalling Glenn Maxwell century

image.altText: A burst of flame outside a tobacco shop.

props.synopsis: Detectives investigating a series of arson attacks on vape and tobacco shops in Melbourne are hoping security vision may lead to a breakthrough.

title.children: Police release vision of vape shop arson attack in Melbourne's north-west

image.altText: White banner saying "another sold" following house sale

props.synopsis: Those wanting to buy a home now have to work at least two years longer to save for the deposit than they did three years ago.

title.children: First home buyers face skipping avo on toast for eight years to access the property market, research indicates

image.altText: Indigenous man with grey hair stands in front of an old mine site which hasn't been cleaned up

props.synopsis: Labelled 'one of the worst polluting mines in Australia', the Redbank Mine has been leaking acid into the environment for almost 30 years. Now traditional owners are calling for it to be rehabilitated before any more new mines are opened in the NT.

title.children: 'Like a scene out of Mad Max': Indigenous leaders call for urgent rehabilitation of toxic former copper mine

image.altText: A black and white portrait of Louise Bourgeois, an elderly woman wearing a black and white blouse touching her hands to her lips

props.synopsis: She's one of the most significant and inventive contemporary artists in history, and now AGNSW is throwing its doors open to the largest exhibition of Louise Bourgeois's work ever shown in Australia.

title.children: How the erotic and psychological art of Louise Bourgeois galvanised a generation of women artists

image.altText: A woman peers to the side in front of a window wearing a black shirt

props.synopsis: As survivors of alleged historical physical and sexual abuse at the hands of foster carers in the Northern Territory seek justice, they say they are battling significant delays and distress akin to "being abused again".

title.children: Mary was repeatedly abused as a child in the foster care system. She's among dozens of survivors battling for justice

image.altText: A screencap of CCTV footage showing the moment a bus started moving towards a petrol station at Casino, NSW.

mediaThumbnail.caption: Quick-thinking 14 year old Izzy Miller stops runaway school bus.

document.synopsis: Quick-thinking 14 year old Izzy Miller stops runaway school bus.

synopsisAlt.lg: Quick-thinking 14 year old Izzy Miller stops runaway school bus.
synopsisAlt.sm: Quick-thinking 14 year old Izzy Miller stops runaway school bus.

children.content: Quick-thinking 14 year old Izzy Miller stops runaway school bus.

teaserText.plain: Quick-thinking 14 year old Izzy Miller stops runaway school bus.

document.title: CCTV footage captures the moment the bus started moving towards the petrol station.

titleAlt.lg: CCTV footage captures the moment the bus started moving towards the petrol station.
titleAlt.md: CCTV footage captures the moment the bus started moving towards the petrol station.
titleAlt.sm: CCTV footage captures the moment the bus started moving towards the petrol station.

document.caption: Quick-thinking 14 year old Izzy Miller stops runaway school bus.

props.synopsis: The 14-year-old girl from Casino High School, who was sitting on the bus with about 20 others, sprung into action when she noticed it moving without anybody in the driver's seat, narrowly preventing what could have been a major disaster.

title.children: Quick-thinking teenage girl saves runaway bus from crashing into New South Wales petrol station
